prompt.content: In 2013, Apple invested in interest rate swaps and designated them as a hedge. Very specifically, what is AAPL hedging and what is the market value of these hedges at the end of FY2013? Express the answer to the nearest 1 decimal in M.

messages.content: [{"criteria":"Interest rate swaps entered in Q3 FY2013","operator":"correctness"},{"operator":"correctness","criteria":"Notional amount of the swaps $3.0B"},{"operator":"correctness","criteria":"Swaps were designated as cash flow hedges"},{"operator":"correctness","criteria":"Hedged item: U.S. dollar floating‑rate note due 2016 with $1,000M face amount"},{"criteria":"Hedged item: U.S. dollar floating‑rate note due 2018 with $2,000M face amount","operator":"correctness"},{"operator":"correctness","criteria":"2016 note bears interest at 3‑month LIBOR + 0.05%"},{"operator":"correctness","criteria":"2018 note bears interest at 3‑month LIBOR + 0.25%"},{"criteria":"Hedge purpose: to hedge variability in cash flows and effectively convert the notes’ interest from floating to fixed","operator":"correctness"},{"criteria":"Derivative assets recorded at September 28, 2013: $44M","operator":"correctness"},{"criteria":"Derivative liabilities recorded at September 28, 2013: $0M","operator":"correctness"},{"criteria":"Net market value of the hedges at FY2013 year‑end: $44.0M","operator":"correctness"},{"operator":"correctness","criteria":"In the swaps Apple receives floating‑rate cash flows and pays a fixed amount"}]
